intro: Erucastrum oleraceum, commonly known as field rape, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in racemes, and it produces spherical, hairy pods containing several seeds. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
